name: Holy Spirit
blurb: Divine agent of conception, anointing, speech, and mission—integral to the triadic baptismal name.

name: Jesus of Nazareth

searchText: jesus of nazareth person messiah davidic and abrahamic heir, true israel in one person. matthew stresses fulfillment: virgin conception (isa 7:14), bethlehem birth (mic 5:2), exodus recapitulation (hos 11:1), temptation victory, authoritative torah fulfillment (5:17–20), suffering servant and risen lord.

name: Kingdom of God
blurb: God’s dynamic reign now and to come; in Matthew the phrase often appears as ‘Kingdom of Heaven’—the canonical label here is ‘Kingdom of God’ with ‘Kingdom of Heaven’ as aka.

name: Simon Peter (Cephas)
blurb: First among equals—confessor and denier, restored to lead. Keys of the kingdom signify teaching/judicial authority under Christ.

name: Moses
blurb: Rescued from the Nile by Pharaoh’s daughter, raised in the court, then exiled to Midian after defending a Hebrew. At the burning bush he meets the God of the fathers; reluctant yet called, he confront
searchText: moses person narrative rescued from the nile by pharaoh’s daughter, raised in the court, then exiled to midian after defending a hebrew. at the burning bush he meets the god of the fathers; reluctant yet called, he confronts pharaoh with signs and speeches, leads through the plagues, and brings israel to the sea. moses’ story in these chapters showcases divine compassion, judgment, and the birth of a nation.

name: Capernaum
blurb: Lakeside hub of teaching and healing; later warned for unbelief.
